roadtrafficdeaths

Source: vignettes/roadtrafficdeaths.Rmd
roadtrafficdeaths.Rmd

The roadtrafficdeaths package contains one dataset of death certificates from road traffic crashes that happened in Brazil. This data is provided by the Brazilian Ministry of Health, and includes all certificated between 1996 and 2021.

Installation

The current version of roadtrafficdeaths can be installed from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("pabsantos/roadtrafficdeaths")

Next, the libraries that will be used in this vignette are loaded. This package loads an data.table object called rtdeaths, so it is recommended to install and load the data.table package as well.

library(roadtrafficdeaths)
library(data.table)

Usage exemple

In this example, we will use the rtdeaths dataset to extract the annual quantity of road traffic deaths in Brazil, between 1996 and 2021.

year_deaths <- rtdeaths[, .N, by = ano_ocorrencia]
setorder(year_deaths, cols = ano_ocorrencia)
year_deaths
#>     ano_ocorrencia     N
#>  1:             NA   101
#>  2:           1996 33075
#>  3:           1997 33457
#>  4:           1998 29081
#>  5:           1999 29214
#>  6:           2000 28596
#>  7:           2001 30047
#>  8:           2002 32487
#>  9:           2003 32686
#> 10:           2004 34709
#> 11:           2005 35666
#> 12:           2006 36128
#> 13:           2007 37168
#> 14:           2008 38012
#> 15:           2009 37266
#> 16:           2010 42501
#> 17:           2011 42885
#> 18:           2012 44431
#> 19:           2013 41892
#> 20:           2014 43409
#> 21:           2015 38337
#> 22:           2016 37067
#> 23:           2017 35075
#> 24:           2018 32389
#> 25:           2019 31684
#> 26:           2020 32509
#> 27:           2021 33568
#>     ano_ocorrencia     N
